Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; above, part of possible lotus bud in added white outline and added red centre; below, traces of two faded white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1700) (phase 2)
